title: First pictures of man shot dead in his black Mercedes in Sheffield as he drove to a family do
text:
Opinion 'I'LL NEVER FORGET YOU' First pictures of man shot dead in his black Mercedes in Sheffield as he drove to a family do 
Aseel was just 23-years-old when he was shot dead with police now launching an investigation By BRITTANY VONOW and HANNAH CROUCH 19th February 2017, 2:10 pm Comments A MAN who was shot dead in broad daylight has been remembered as a “top lad”. 
The 23-year-old man, named locally as Aseel, was either in or near a black Mercedes that he had been driving to a family do when he was shot in the chest in the Upperthorpe area on Saturday. Facebook 5 The young man shot dead in broad daylight has been named locally as Aseel 
Friends have now shared tributes to the young man, with one friend writing: “Will never forget him , I always use to see him in the area, He was, He was a top lad. May allah bless his family and give them patient (sic) to get through this hard time”. 
She added that he would “always be missed”. 
Another friend wrote: “RIP sweetheart never forget all the laughs we had. just dont seem real”. Guzelian The young man was in or near the Black Mercedes when he was shot SWNS:South West News Service Cops at the scene where a man was shot in the chest in a busy street in Sheffield at lunchtime on Saturday SWNS:South West News Service 5 The 23-year-old man was taken to hospital where he was treated for a gunshot wound but later died 
Another friend shared a photograph of the young man, saying: “I will never forget the time we had brother” while another wrote: “It brings a tear to my eye to know that someone who you’ve know for so many years to get taken from this world in the cruelest way possible. 
“I still don’t believe it! Such a funny guy, too many memories! Taken too soon fly safe”. 
Police swarmed to the area as the young man was rushed to hospital after the shooting on Daniel Hill, but he sadly died soon after. 
Local residents said the man was a member of a family who live close to the scene of the shooting on Daniel Hill, between the Upperthorpe and Walkley areas of the city. 
They said relatives had been gathering for a family celebration on Saturday when the man was shot. 
Many came out of the house to try to help him after hearing the incident, neighbours said. 
After police officers established a cordon around the Mercedes on Daniel Hill, more relatives arrived in the street, clearly distraught. A South Yorkshire Police spokeswoman said: “A 23-year-old man has died following a reported shooting on Daniel Hill, Walkley, Sheffield, this afternoon (Saturday). 
“At around 1.35pm police were called to Daniel Hill following reports that a man had been shot. 
“The 23-year-old man was taken to Northern General Hospital with a suspected gunshot wound. He died a short time later. 
“Police are currently investigating the incident and anyone who was in the area at the time, or has information about the incident is urged to contact police on 101 quoting incident number 571 of 18 February.” Guzelian 5 Forensic officers examined the Mercedes after the fatal shooting 
On Saturday afternoon, a section of Daniel Hill was sealed off either side of the Mercedes car, which had its front windows open and was parked by the side of the road. 
A large number of officers and forensic examiners were also at the southern end, near the commercial centre of Upperthorpe, where a number of shops and cafes are located. 
There have been a spate of shootings in Sheffield in recent weeks, although all the previous incidents have been in the north of the city and none have been close to the Upperthorpe area. 
People watching the police activity said they could not remember another shooting in the area. 
One man said: “Upperthorpe has had its problems but it’s been better recently. I’ve never heard of a shooting here. I’m shocked.”
